creator: edith@apache.org
text: There are other attributes, like href, visibleinnav, ...

creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
A quick look at the API of SiteTreeNode
 
http://lenya.apache.org/apidocs/1.2/org/apache/lenya/cms/publication/SiteTreeNode.html

shows that there are 5 methods for getting (system) attributes:

- getHref()  -> @href
- getId()  -> @id
- getSuffix()  -> @suffix
- hasLink()  -> @link
- visibileInNav()  -> @visibleinnav

There is also a method for setting additional attributes:

  setNodeAttribute(...)

but I can't see any method for getting these additional attributes through
the SiteTreeNode interface.

In a first step, I will implement the retrieval of the "system" attributes.
How the additional attributes are accessed has to be discussed
(a look to sitetree2nav.xsl shows that there may be some more attributes:
@protected, @folder, ...).

creator: josias.thoeny@wyona.org
text:
The 'protected' and the 'folder' attribute are not stored in the sitetree
itself, they are later added to the xml by some pipelines. So I think the
SitetreeGenerator does not have to care about those two attributes.

Created attachment 14618
Patch for SiteTreeGenerator.

Can you please check if the patch does what it is supposed to do and close the
bug if it's ok.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
